extractions.extraction_text: the death of such a once great character

attributes.subject: The Predator character
attributes.key_phrase: death of such a once great character

text:
**Page 1**
"""
It's just not Predator anymore...sigh. 
This movie looked great, it felt good, and it had action...But this isn't Predator...lol it's 
just a move about monsters and creatures fighting...it's a kid's movie...Felt like I was 
watching a generic SciFi movie with good visuals...This isn't a horror movie anymore, if 
you think about it, this is the same story as Lilo and Stitch   the Predator IS STITCH...I 
PREY this is just a one-off spin-off type of movie...I actually liked Predator 2018 even 
though it had bad writing...this movie was just too child like for me...and i will definitely 
blame Disney for that....but of course, we all knew this would happen...So if you have 
kids just take them to see, but as for the older crowd, The presence of Schwarzenegger 
and a Terrifying human hunter has evaporated into dust particles! 
Predator: Badlands Brings the Hunt, the Heart, and the Hype 
It's finally here, a Predator movie that doesn't take itself too seriously, yet remains 
incredibly well-made and thoroughly entertaining, Dan Trachtenberg, who already 
delivered the most serious and still the best Predator film to date with Prey, is clearly 
having a blast with Predator: Badlands, from the very first scene, the movie hooks you 
with one of the most exciting and promising intros in the franchise. 
 
This is the closest we've ever gotten to seeing the Predator as an actual character, 
complete with personality, language, and depth, and it works remarkably well, adding to 
that, Elle Fanning is a great addition to the film, and the little creature named Bud also 
brings unexpected charm to the film. 
 
Besides being one of the most excitingly entertaining films of the year, Predator: 
Badlands, in my opinion, the most wholesome buddy cop movie i've seen in a while, the 
beautifully shot, vast, and dark Predator world gives off Dune vibes for me, while the 
introduction of fascinating new creatures evokes a touch of Avatar, i genuinely adore the 
world building they've did in the film, it's visually stunning. 
 
The action and fight sequences are exciting, and the Predator is as badass as ever, while 
the pacing slows down in the second half, overall, Predator: Badlands is pure fun, 
exciting, and wildly entertaining, i wouldn't mind another installment, as long as Dan 
Trachtenberg returns to direct it, because honestly, the best Predator movies are the
"""

**Page 2**
"""
last three, all under his direction. 
An insult to original fans 
I do not know why Imdb is erasing opinions that doesn't match with +7 stars or above 
with this movie. I know Disney always bans everything that they don't like, like criticism. 
So, hopefully I can express how disappointed I was watching this movie. 
 
My opinion is that Disney has destroyed two of my favorite franchises of all time: Alien 
and Predator. My god. This new movie is a lame cartoonish network one. So, bad. No 
blood. No action, just a Chat GPT movie. Just superficial, empty without substance, like 
the real world today. 
Give Hollywood long enough, it'll ruin everything... 
So after the Disneyfication of Star Wars and Alien, we finally get around to the abject 
ruination of the beloved Predator series. True, Shane Black came mighty close with The 
Predator back in 2018 and best not mention Alien v. Predator: Requiem at all but, in the 
excellent wake of Prey and Predator: Killer of Killers, hopes were extremely high for 
whatever Dan Trachtenberg would come up with next. 
 
And then this. Predator meets the Mickey Mouse club or Predator and Stitch. Whatever, 
you get the picture. What we have been dished up here is the very furthest thing we 
could possibly have been given from the Predator we know and love. 
 
I won't go into the depressing details of what we actually have to endure for the sake of 
the poor suckers who are going to spend their hard earned sheckles seeing this mess 
but I just need to say that Elle Fanning and Dimitrius Schuster-Koloamatangi give it their 
best... and that's about it. Too much CGI, not enough horror and absolutely no tension. 
 
This is gonna take a lot of coming back from.... 
It's Predator, just more comic book than movie! 
This movie was highly anticipated by me. I am a fan of not only the movie, but more 
importantly, the comics! Anyone who is only watching the movies, is missing the 
backstories and sequels to the movies. I won't make this a long winded review, you can
"""

**Page 3**
"""
scroll anywhere else and read those. This is more of a "why" to the direction of the 
movie. 
 
I'm glad I allowed myself to be open to new ideas regarding the franchise. This movie 
played to the comics ideas of the Predator aka the Yautja, and showed actual depth to 
them. It's very easy to get caught up in the idea of them being a villain only, and never 
understanding who they're an actual villain too and why. Like running into a tiger in the 
woods. It could kill you and still look majestic asf later while playing with its cub lol. The 
movie Predator gives us the look into the culture and family life of the Yautja. You don't 
see human interaction or hunting of humans. You see the evolution of a Predator and 
why its honor and anger are so one and the same. The lust for a better hunt is explained 
in the comics well and now for the first time, on screen from the side of the Predator. 
This is again, comic driven. Yes the comics get gory and graphic, but not all of them are 
about that too. This was a wonderful set up for future movies to follow. The action was 
on point. The comedic relief was needed. It's Disney being Disney and grooming the 
next wave of fans. Some of the characters are added in there I believe to make this less 
of a monster movie and more of an action movie. We have the horror style Predators. I 
feel like those did very little to expand the fan base and secure it for more generations to 
come. The horror style played to the already existing theme that older fans wanted to 
see. 
 
Go see the movie and make your own conclusions. After that, look up the comics. 
There's so much more story that is explained outside of the big screen. 
Should be called "Badlands" only. 
This would have been a good monster vs monster movie if they simply took the Predator 
out of the movie and replaced with some other alien. The new Predator look nothing like 
the other clan members of the original movies, and has way more human qualities. 
Understandable that he was a weak clan member, but being dopey, scared, lied and 
cheated on is not exactly a predator. 
 
Even if weaponry had no resemblance of the original predators. 
Why is it a comedy?
"""

**Page 4**
"""
I only watched the teaser trailer and got really intrigued so had high expectations for this 
one. Color me surprised when it turns out to be a comedy after 20 minutes. 
 
The plot has potential but instead checks off almost every cliche, we've seen this plenty 
of times before with humans. But why with an alien, that doesn't make any sense? 
 
Key points with bad decision making: 1. Giving the predators dialogue - they've barely 
said anything before in prior movies. 
 
2. Main protagonist predator showing his face 90% of the time - audience can connect 
with characters who doesn't show face 3. Making main protagonist weak just like any 
modern film today. It's not revolutionary, just weird. The predators are supposed to be 
ruthless hunters 
 
Prey was much better and Elle Fanning had an interesting character but all joking was 
over the top. I expected a much darker sci-fi movie. 
Really disappointed 
I tried to keep an open mind coming into the cinema bur knew within 20 minutes this 
was going to be hard to sit through. 
 
I can appreciate the director trying to expand the lore and Predator Universe but 
everything Stan Winston created has been watered down so 12 year olds can watch it. 
 
What was once ominous, scary and flat out brutal has been replaced by heavy amounts 
of cgi, a story straight out of the Mandalorian that is completely tone deaf in terms of 
what this character used to be. 
 
Family and kids will love it but for audiences that loved what the Predator used to be, 
stick with rewatching the originals because you are going to be very disappointed. 
Unfortunately yet again we are seeing the death of such a once great character so 
studious can make money from mass audiences.
"""
